text: Now you may have noticed that we've introduced quite a large number of terms early on,
but again, as I stated at the outset, you shouldn't worry or concern yourself particularly with
remembering all of them. In fact, it's not a bad thing to forget them at all. As you'll have
noticed, I've already started reintroducing concepts that we mentioned early on, and this
will happen throughout the course. So again, always trying to remember and never letting
yourself forget anything wouldn't be a good thing. If you're forgetting words, that's a good thing.
They will come up, and by the end of the course, you will know them, and you will understand how
to use them in French. As we mentioned earlier, it is in French is...
It is not in French is...
It is not...
It is not romantic. It is not exotic. It is not...
It is not exotic. How would you say, I would like to know if it is not exotic. It is not...
It is not exotic.
The word for why in French is pourquoi, pourquoi, which literally means for what.
So, in English you could say, why do I have to do this?
But you might also say, for what reason do I have to do it?
And in French they'll always say for what.
For what do I have to go there?
For what reason do I have to do it?
So, pourquoi is for what?
With that in mind, how would you say, I would like to know why it's not romantic?
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi ce n'est pas romantique.
How would you say, I would like to know why you have prepared the dinner?
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi vous avez préparé le dîner.
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi je ne vous en prie.
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi je ne vous en prie.
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi je ne vous en prie.
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi je ne vous en prie.
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi je ne vous en prie.
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi je ne vous en prie.
Je voudrais savoir pourquoi je ne vous en prie.
